cells.data:
Lattice Point: point on plane $(x,y) \in \mathbb{R}^2, x,y \in \mathbb{Z}$

Pick's Theorem
For a simple polygon $P$ whose vertices are lattice points:
Let $A$ be the area, $I$ be the number of interior lattice points, $B$ be the number of boundary lattice points
$A = I+B-1$

Relations, Counting and Probability

Relation: between sets $A,B$, is a subset $R$ of $A \times B$
if $(a,b) \in R$, $a R b$

Can have a relation on $A$, that is, $R \subseteq A \times A$
$\mid A \mid = n \implies \mid A \times A \mid = n^2 \implies $ number of relations $ = 2^{n^2}$

Properties of relations:
Relation on a set is reflexive if $\forall a \in A, (a,a) \in R$
Symmetric if $\forall a,b, aRb \implies bRa$
Anti-symmetric if $\forall a,b (aRb) \land (bRa) \implies (a = b)$
Transitive if $\forall a,b,c (aRb) \land (bRc) \implies (aRc)$

Equivalence Relation: Symmetric, Transitive, Reflexive
